title: Armor Assault
text:
Armor Assault is a <a href="turn-based%20strategy">turn-based strategy</a> video game written by John Weber for the <a href="Atari%208-bit%20family">Atari 8-bit family</a> and published in 1982 by <a href="Automated%20Simulations">Automated Simulations</a>. It is a game in which tactical level armor warfare is simulated between <a href="NATO">NATO</a> and Soviet forces.
Gameplay.
"Armor Assault" is a tactical simulation of <a href="tank">tank</a> warfare in hypothetical World War III between <a href="NATO">NATO</a> and the <a href="Soviet%20Union">Soviet Union</a>, in a variety of scenarios from the Rhine to Afghanistan. Each side controls six tanks, armed with guided missiles and mines. The player can select from 12 scenarios and variety of terrain: jungle, desert, river, city and mountain ranges. Each turn player maneuvers his tanks, mines and guided missiles, destroying his foe's forces with opportunity and direct fire. Movement is affected by terrain and type of fire implemented.
Reception.
Floyd Mathews reviewed the game for "<a href="Computer%20Gaming%20World">Computer Gaming World</a>", and stated that "All factors considered, Armor Assault is a game with many good features, the best of which are the ability gives of during a wide range of scenarios and the inclusion of simultaneous movement and opportunity fire."
